definitions.definition: Of, or pertaining to, the Apocrypha .
Of doubtful authenticity , or lacking authority ; not regarded as canonical .
examples: Many scholars consider the stories of the monk Teilo to be apocryphal .

definitions.definition: Of dubious veracity ; of questionable accuracy or truthfulness; anecdotal or in the nature of an urban legend .
examples: There is an apocryphal tale of a little boy plugging the dike with his finger.

main_definition: ( Christianity ) Of, or pertaining to, the Apocrypha .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) Of doubtful authenticity , or lacking authority ; not regarded as canonical . [from 1590s]
( by extension ) Of dubious veracity ; of questionable accuracy or truthfulness; anecdotal or in the nature of an urban legend .
